title: Am I the only one finding it hilarious that the minute mages are becoming strong again...
body: There are posts ranting about how OP certain mages are even when they are completely balanced?

replies.body: When a {{champion:50}} can out sustain an ADC late game, something is wrong.

I mean, that's kind of what swain is meant to do.

it's like saying that because an adc has more attack speed than a mage they are broken.
ADCs are supposed to be able to self sustain (many times getting 50-100 HP per auto) with fast auto attacks.

> [{quoted}](name=doiminat0r3600,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=IETQPOAH,comment-id=000100010000,timestamp=2016-07-05T16:02:56.870+0000)
>
> ADCs are supposed to be able to self sustain (many times getting 50-100 HP per auto) with fast auto attacks.

They're not meant to, no.

Swain, on the other hand, is made to be a spellvamping monstrosity.

Then what are ADCs supposed to do? 

They do massive amounts of AD with a sustain in the item or 2 so they can actually survive getting hit by an AOE attack or a stray bullet. They are meant to do the damage but they can't do it without sustain.

> [{quoted}](name=doiminat0r3600,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=IETQPOAH,comment-id=00010001000000010000,timestamp=2016-07-05T22:36:12.042+0000)

> Then what are ADCs supposed to do? 
> 
> They do massive amounts of AD with a sustain in the item or 2 so they can actually survive getting hit by an AOE attack or a stray bullet. They are meant to do the damage but they can't do it without sustain.

They are meant to pick off people from afar, and kill towers, not have the luxury to take "an aoe attack or a stray bullet" and heal it right back like nothing happened.

Marksman are supposed to pick off people from a distance (not *that* far of a distance). They are meant to pick people off and not be touched, but are they supposed to be sitting ducks against melee attackers? Are they supposed to be able to kill 4 squishies and a tank whilst being targeted by the enemy team and walk out with most of their health?

Maybe with good positioning but they aren't supposed to be able to sit in one spot and right click to survive without some form of sustain (lifesteal).

Edit: If they were the only ones meant to kill towers efficiently, then why can late game mages chunk towers and inhibs like theyre nothing?

While I understand some sustain, they shouldn't be outsustaining a drain tank. And they also shouldn't be outsustaining a melee carry. 

The point is, they shouldn't be able to eat their cake and have it too. Too bad with crit, attack speed, range, and tons of ad, plus AD items with copious amounts of lifesteal, we have to deal with sustain gods with each auto attack being stronger than a mage spell. Ahem, show me just how many mages have 1000 damage spells. 

As for mages chunking towers, it's because Rito thought it was a good idea, but also because the midlaner shouldn't be absolutely useless if he scored an ace but he's the last one alive on the team. 

Think about it, while ADCs are the turret killers, if they were the only ones who were capable of doing it both teams wouldn't even have to do anything other than focus fhe adc. Enemy team has 3 people alive but you got aced? No problem you got their adc.

Not to mention ADCs are the best objective killers.
Who plays jihn as magic? Likewise zed & talon are physical ASSASSINS.

You don't have to play an AP champion for them to not be considered a mage. Look at Ez. He does mixed damage (primarily AP but is still played bot lane) but could be considered a physical damage spell caster (AD Mage).

Anyone that casts spells or abilities for a lot of their damage could be considered a mage.

By that logic you could play kayle as a marksmen since she relies mostly on auto-attacks; but again who does that? Nobody, for two reasons; it's impractical due to taking a while to get her the right items, and from the meta-maniacs making the game environment so hostile to anything outside of the standard. 

When I say mage, I'm referring to champions that deal near exclusively magic damage; of your examples veigar, swain, velkoz, & vladimir are spot on. Champions that just rely on abilities can be in the net group of casters, such as zed & ezreal. 

I don't remember where at the moment, but I made a comment on how marksmen could be split into two groups, casters & auto-attackers; ezreal & corki being examples of casters, while vayne & sivir as examples of auto-attackers. Which I classify them from how they deal their damage, not what damage they deal, mostly from riot mixing several things together these days.
some mages are meant to have good auto speed. still doesn't change that fact that adc's should have more.

They might have good auto speed but don't build AD and Life Steal. They dont get 50-100 lifesteal 2 times a second late game. 

Swain gets health for every bird hit and mana for every last hit. If they are allowed to get 100+ health 3-5 times a second when he builds mainly tank, then there is something wrong.

No, you just don't grasp the concept of a character that plays differently from your poorly conceived architype.
Swain is a drain tank. his whole shtick is the healing nonsense.
im talking about dumb shit like claiming rylais is breaking every champion in the game.

It provides a lot of utility, damage, and health tbh.

It would be better if they actually didn't have every item for AP champions having 100 AP (except voidstaff and liandry's)

only 4 items (to my knowledge) give 100 ap.
Everything else gives below that (other than rabadons.)
TFW rabadons is not longer essential for a mage.

Which is why I didn't mention it.

It's 100% optional if you want to get that extra oomph in your damage.

Supports just get tossed around really. If they're strong, they're on accident. If they're weak, it's on accident. Nothing with them is on purpose unless Riot directly changes them.
It's not like it's an actually role right? XD
Well, from a support main, they are probably the most crucial role in the game. Filling the gaps of burst, utility, and even just flat out sustain on the team.

what you said has reminded me of something that I posted recently.

a zoologist is calling an astronomist stupid because he doesn't know the genus of cat he's looking at, and the meteorologist is laughing at them both because they don't realise that it's about to rain, and the botanist is yelling at the meteorologist because he's standing under a death tree.

Zoologist is top, astronomist is jungle, meteorologist is adc, botanist is support, genus of cat is lane dynamic, rain is the enemy team collapsing, death tree is tower without allied minions.

All the lanes are very different, and while you might seem like you're more crucial because you are good at yours, what you're role does doesn't necessarily translate.

Considering that Mid lane is just sorta there for damage (generally AP) and ADC is actually there for damage (AD), top lane is generally a tank/bruiser, and jungle is for map pressure objectives. Support has most of the team's utility 90% of the time.

Mid is generally the team's source of burst, so they serve as the team's anti champion. it is in their hands to make sure the fed enemy dies. they also tend to be the team's source of waveclear, and hold the best position other than jungle for giving top or bot relief. they are an important asset in all those regards.

Adc is generally the team's best source of sustained damage, so they serve as the team's anti objective. it is in their hands to make sure that after fights your team secures an objective or two. they also tend to be the team's source of cleanup, and hold the team's safest position even during mid and late game due to this. they are an important asset in all those regards.

Top is generally the team's best multitool, so they serve as whatever the team needs them to be. It is in their hands to make sure that your team has all the tools it needs to succeed. they also tend to hold teleport, and therefore tend to be the best splitters and anti splitters throughout the game. they are an important asset through the game due to this.

Jungle is generally the team's pressure builder, so they serve as the team's anti everything. It is in their hands to make sure that the enemy doesn't gain ground without losing it somewhere else. they also tend to be their team's best objective securers, and hold the best ganking position to snowball lanes. they are an important asset in all those regards.


There is no one stat that shows one position as being better than the others. they all have different jobs.

Just because the baker can make better bread than the butcher doesn't mean that you don't still need both.
